italic.text: A member of the Armed Forces assigned to accompany, assist, or guide an individual or group. An armed guard that accompanies a convoy, a train, prisoners, etc.

line.text: In SWORD, to accompany a refugees or surrendered units toward a specific location (a position or a camp for instance).
Lines used by units to adapt their behavior when they reach or cross them.

Camp into which the agent has to accompany the surrendered units.
Surrendered units to be transported to the given camp.
The commander agent issues the "EscortPrisonersToCamp" mission to each of the first echelon units,
The number of first echelon units depends on the number of surrendered units to escort (one surrendered unit corresponds to one surbodinate unit).
The commander agent issues the "follow" mission with the first echelon units as parameter.
In case of an attack by an enemy or bad force ratio, combat units of the second echelon may receive the "combat support" mission (the enemy may be engaged).
The mission ends when all surrendered units have been jailed into the camp.
